results.title: Changes in peripheral mitochondrial DNA copy number in metformin-treated women with polycystic ovary syndrome: a longitudinal study
results.text_hl: This may signify a reduction in @<m>DISEASE_Myopathy_with_Giant_Abnormal_Mitochondria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C564971 @@@mitochondria dysfunction@@@.

results.title: Metformin ameliorates mitochondrial damage induced by C9orf72 poly(GR) via upregulating AKT phosphorylation.

results.title: Metformin ameliorates ferroptosis in cardiac ischemia and reperfusion by reducing NOX4 expression via promoting AMPKalpha

results.title: Evaluating oxidative stress targeting treatments in in vitro models of placental stress relevant to preeclampsia.
results.text_hl: Custom-made first trimester trophoblast cell line, @CELLLINE_CVCL:4829 @@@ACH-3P@@@, was exposed to various @DISEASE_Pre_Eclampsia @DISEASE_MESH:D011225 @@@preeclampsia@@@-like stimuli including @DISEASE_Hypoxia @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@hypoxia@@@ mimetic (@CHEMICAL_oxalylglycine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C040947 @@@dimethyloxalylglycine@@@ or DMOG, 1 mM), @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@ (tumour necrosis factor or @GENE_TNF @GENE_7124 @@@TNF-alpha@@@, 10 ng/mL) or @<m>DISEASE_Myopathy_with_Giant_Abnormal_Mitochondria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C564971 @@@mitochondria dysfunction@@@ agent, (@CHEMICAL_rhodamine_6G @CHEMICAL_MESH:C026188 @@@Rhodamine-6G@@@ or Rho-6G, 1 mug/mL), +- @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@ (0.5 mM), @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (0.5 mM), AD-01 (100 nM) or @CHEMICAL_Resveratrol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077185 @@@resveratrol@@@ (15 microM), for 48 h.

citations.NLM: Afrose D, Johansen MD, Nikolic V, Karadzov Orlic N, Mikovic Z, Stefanovic M, Cakic Z, Hansbro PM, McClements L. Evaluating oxidative stress targeting treatments in in vitro models of placental stress relevant to preeclampsia. Front Cell Dev Biol. 2025;13():1539496. PMID: 40109359
citations.BibTeX: @article{40109359, title={Evaluating oxidative stress targeting treatments in in vitro models of placental stress relevant to preeclampsia.}, author={Afrose D and Johansen MD and Nikolic V and Karadzov Orlic N and Mikovic Z and Stefanovic M and Cakic Z and Hansbro PM and McClements L}, journal={Front Cell Dev Biol}, volume={13}, pages={1539496}}
